description:
Przed nami ogromne zmiany

Polska znajduje się w pierwszej dziesiątce krajów o największej liczbie pobrań oprogramowania dla portfela Bitcoin oraz wśród 10 krajów, w których jest najwyższe zainteresowanie Bitcoinami, jak to wykazują statystyki wyszukiwania Google Trends.

Z kolei, według serwisu gromadzącego dane o miejscach akceptujących płatności Bitcoin na świecie - Warszawa posiada 27 takich miejsc, czyli więcej niż Frankfurt (18), Monachium (21) czy Budapeszt (13) i nie wiele mniej niż Praga (35), Berlin (56) czy Londyn (65).

W roku 2013 w Warszawie powstał InPay - pierwszy w Polsce i jeden z pierwszych w Europie system płatności i akceptacji Bitcoin dedykowany sprzedawcom tradycyjnym oraz internetowym.

InPay S.A. została zarejestrowana 26 czerwca 2014 roku, przeznaczając pierwsze pozyskane środki na organizację spółki akcyjnej, na rozwój technologii oraz zabezpieczenie kwestii prawno-skarbowych. Teraz, dzięki ofercie publicznej akcji spółki, chcemy pozyskać finansowanie szybkiego rozwoju systemu InPay w Polsce i w Europie.

Chcemy aby liczba miejsc akceptujących płatności Bitcoin w naszym kraju rosła. Pragniemy działać w interesie przedsiębiorców - ograniczając ich koszty transakcyjne oraz upraszczając działania, a także w interesie akcjonariuszy - zwiększając wartość spółki InPay S.A. i wysokość dywidend.

Zapraszamy do zapoznania się z opisem projektu InPay i do zakupu naszych akcji online.

Przedstawiamy InPay

InPay to system płatniczy przyszłości. InPay powstał aby umożliwić sprzedawcom akceptację płatności Bitcoinami, uwalniając ich od konieczności płacenia wysokich prowizji pośrednikom i bankom. Dzięki temu mogą zaoferować niższe ceny kupującym.

Jak działa InPay?

InPay usuwa bariery przed właścicielami sklepów stacjonarnych i internetowych, którzy chcą przystąpić do akceptowania płatności Bitcoinami.

Właściciel biznesu, który chce skupić się na prowadzeniu swojej działalności, a nie spekulacji aktywami o wysokiej zmienności, ma gwarancję, że na konto bankowe zostanie przelana kwota w równowartości wystawionych faktur i paragonów. Przedsiębiorca otrzymuje przelew na konto o takiej samej wartości jaką otrzymałby gotówką.

Zamrożenie kursu z momentu sprzedaży to podstawowa funkcja, której oczekuje rynek, bowiem przyjmowanie płatności w Bitcoinach pociąga za sobą potencjalne zagrożenie związane z fluktuacją ceny. Ten problem szczególnie dotyczy Bitcoina, który znany jest z bardzo gwałtownych zmian kursu.

Dla firm, które już wcześniej rozważały akceptowanie płatności Bitcoinami lub zdecydowały się już na wykorzystanie dostępnych narzędzi (elektronicznych portfeli) InPay oferuje następujące udogodnienia:

  • Płatności bez prowizji, czyli brak konieczności księgowania rozbieżności wynikających z przyjmowania płatności elektronicznych;
  • Unikatowe adresy wpłat dla każdej transakcji, które pozwalają na zachowanie tajemnicy handlowej i nie udostępnianie informacji o obrotach osobom nieupoważnionym;
  • Możliwość przyjmowania jedynie wpłat bez możliwości wypłacania środków, co eliminuje ryzyko wypłacenia środków przez nieuprawnionego pracownika ;
  • Powiązanie płatności z meta danymi transakcji, takimi jak numery paragonów / faktur, itd. dla lepszego raportowania;
  • Innowacyjne uproszczenie bezpiecznego systemu rozliczeń np. w gastronomii, itp. czyli dedykowane konta dla pracowników, zamknięcia zmiany itp.

Przy każdej próbie dokonania transakcji, system InPay automatycznie wyszukuje najlepsze oferty kupna z giełd światowych. Dzięki temu, InPay jest w stanie zarabiać na różnicach kursowych bez ponoszenia ryzyka, a osoby płacące mogą liczyć na otrzymanie kursu wymiany lepszego niż same byłyby w stanie uzyskać na poszczególnych giełdach.

W jaki sposób InPay S.A. zarobi na siebie?

InPay S.A. zarabia na obrocie certyfikatami elektronicznymi Bitcoin. W czasie rzeczywistym, korzystając z dostępu do coraz większej liczby giełd i w pełni zautomatyzowanego procesu wyboru najniższej możliwej wartości konwersji w danym czasie. Mówiąc w skrócie, InPay S.A. nie gromadzi Bitcoinów, ale w umiejętny sposób sprzedaje je w czasie rzeczywistym, z zyskiem.

Co zyskujemy kupując akcje InPay S.A.?

Bitcoin staje się coraz bardziej popularny na świecie. To rynek globalny. Wzrost liczby transakcji dokonywanych za pomocą Bitcoin systematycznie rośnie. Startupy, które dzisiaj zaledwie zaczynają operować na tym rynku, w przyszłości staną się jego liderami. Wspierając alternatywne rozwiązania płatnicze stymulujemy konkurencję na dość zamkniętym rynku o wysokich barierach wejścia. Większa konkurencyjność dzięki tanim rozwiązaniom takim jak InPay, to w efekcie presja na dostawców klasycznych metod płatności, aby zmniejszyli z własnej woli np. opłatę interchange. Wierzymy, że zdrowa konkurencja przyniesie lepsze rezultaty niż unijne dyrektywy, a konsumenci zyskają niższe ceny dzięki zwiększeniu rentowności przedsiębiorstw.

Co stanowi o przewadze rynkowej InPay S.A.?

Twórcy systemu InPay przez ostatnie 12 miesięcy przygotowywali się do uruchomienia spółki i pozyskania finansowania. To nie jest łatwy proces, szczególnie w środowisku skomplikowanych przepisów prawnych i podatkowych. InPay S.A. nie chce narażać swoich klientów działając zgodnie z polskim oraz unijnym prawem. Dlatego dużą część czasu i środków finansowych poświęciliśmy na dokładne opracowanie tej tematyki.

InPay S.A. posiada zaawansowaną i sprawdzoną technologię, ale jej dalszy rozwój wymaga więcej czasu i zasobów.

Kto tworzy InPay S.A.?

Oprogramowanie InPay zostało stworzone przez Lecha Wilczyńskiego i Sławomira Więcha, deweloperów z wieloletnim doświadczeniem. Już na studiach na warszawskiej Polsko-Japońskiej Wyższej Szkole Technik Komputerowych tworzyli razem oprogramowanie, które pomagało uczelni testować zdolności programistyczne studentów. Przez lata Sławek zdobywał doświadczenie jako lider zespołów IT w dużej firmie ubezpieczeniowej, a Lech tworzył oprogramowanie B2B wykorzystywane przez sklepy internetowe, a następnie tworzył rozwiązanie audio-marketingu wykorzystywane w sieciach handlowych w całym kraju.

Przez ostatnie kilka lat Bitcoin interesował ich jako bardzo ciekawy eksperyment, z którego potencjału doskonale sobie zdawali sprawę. W drugiej połowie 2013 roku podjęli decyzję, że nie ma co czekać aż zachodnie serwisy przejmą polski rynek, że trzeba działać mimo jeszcze niezbyt jasnego statusu prawnego Bitcoina w Polsce.

InPay pozyskał inwestora i mentora w osobie Arkadiusza Osiaka, założyciela m.in. portalu Money.pl. Dzięki temu, zdecydowaliśmy o powołaniu spółki akcyjnej, zabezpieczeniu jej od strony podatkowej i prawnej, przygotowaniu oferty publicznej akcji. Arek wspiera młodą spółkę, prowadzoną przez technicznych co-founderów, w zakresie strategii rozwoju.

Oferta publiczna akcji:

InPay S.A. oferuje możliwość nabycia w drodze oferty publicznej 5.000 akcji własnych Spółki, tj. 5% kapitału zakładowego, po cenie 40,00 zł każda. W celu nabycia wybranej liczby akcji prosimy o przejście do systemu transakcyjnego crowdfunding.inpay.pl

Jak wykorzystamy środki pozyskane z oferty publicznej akcji spółki?

Środki z oferty publicznej umożliwią nam zbudowanie zespołu sprzedażowego, dotarcie do większej liczby sprzedawców, dalszy rozwój oprogramowania, a wkrótce też, ekspansję na pozostałe kraje europejskie. Więcej informacji na ten temat znajduje się w naszym biznesplanie, dostępnym po kliknięciu w link: inpay.pl.

Misja

Płatności bezgotówkowe powinny być proste a przede wszystkim bezpieczne, tanie i wygodne. Jednak współczesne rozwiązania płatnicze posiadają duże braki w tym względzie, są kontrowersyjne pod względem ochrony oszczędności i prywatności. Płatności gotówkowe natomiast, wiążą się ze sporymi kosztami obsługi i chcąc nie chcąc podążamy w kierunku społeczeństwa bezgotówkowego. Wiele osób dostrzega jednak potencjalne zagrożenia płynące z takiej przemiany. Wierzymy, że da się wykorzystać technologię w sposób, który usprawni handel, zmniejszy koszty transakcyjne, a jednocześnie pozwoli chronić prawo do prywatności i zarządzania swoimi finansami bez ograniczeń.

Narzędzia

Technologia, która jest w stanie sprostać tak rozumianej misji opiera się na koncepcji, która do 2009 roku nie miała swojej implementacji w praktyce. Ostatnie pięć lat pokazało jak fantastyczne możliwości stoją otworem przed nami, że ten całkowicie oddolnie realizowany eksperyment przetrwał próbę czasu i rośnie w siłę do niewyobrażalnej wcześniej skali. Bitcoin stał się dowodem na to, że zdecentralizowane aplikacje począwszy od użycia jako środek wymiany przez prawa majątkowe i inteligentne kontrakty po mechanizmy składowania danych w chmurze, mogą funkcjonować o wiele lepiej i bezpiecznej niż scentralizowane rozwiązania.

Tak jak 100 lat temu bracia Wright unieśli w powietrze człowieka i maszynę, tak kilka lat temu jednemu człowiekowi udało się znaleźć rozwiązanie problemu, który dotąd nie miał praktycznego rozwiązania, czyli sposób na uzyskanie konsensusu w zdecentralizowanej sieci komputerowej. Pierwszą aplikacją tego wynalazku są certyfikaty elektroniczne Bitcoin.

Edukacja społeczeństwa

Mamy do czynienia z ogromną zmianą cywilizacyjną na skalę światową, największą od stu lat, która następuje bez względu na podejście poszczególnych jurysdykcji. Następuje zmiana utartych przekonań dotyczących podstawowych pojęć. Spotyka się to jednak z ogromnym niedowierzaniem społeczeństwa, no bo nie pomaga tu konieczność rozumienia koncepcji związanych z kryptografią, sieciami komputerowymi, obsługą aplikacji, czy zwykłego "smartfona".

Chcemy to zmienić organizując szkolenia, a przede wszystkim sprawić, aby w każdym sklepie można było użyć nowej metody. To pierwszy krok. Zdajemy sobie sprawę, że czeka nas ciężka praca u podstaw, edukowania konsumentów i przedsiębiorców. Nie dokonamy tego bez Waszej pomocy, zaangażowania finansowego i osobistego.

Niniejszy materiał ma wyłącznie charakter promocyjny i reklamowy, a rodzaj oferty publicznej nie wymaga udostępnienia prospektu emisyjnego.

Załączniki

  • Umowa pomiędzy użytkownikiem Beesfund, a InPay S.A.

Komentarze

Uwaga - każda wersja językowa portalu posiada oddzielne komentarze do projektu. Komentarze zamieszczane na naszym serwisie podlegają Regulaminowi komentowania.

description:
Easbit develops the most granny proof Bitcoin
wallet for Android smartphones Introduction of ourselves First of all we are obviously very strong believers and real enthusiasts of
the Bitcoin. Due to the global crisis and a decreasing trust in the monetary financial
systems we believe that the world is in urge of a new and transparent currency
which cannot be interfered and/or be influenced by humans or central banks. Our team has two Dutch co-founders. Our backgrounds lays in banking, IT and
marketing. Because of our backgrounds we became truly passionate about
Bitcoins. We have heard from the phenomenon Bitcoin since early 2010. We have
seen close by how the financial crises emerged. In the news you still hear on a
daily base that CEO’s get well overpaid and banks go bankrupt. That is exactly
what we see as very unfair since the normal hard working tax payer has to work
around the clock and pay eventually for the caused damage. We have a clear vision about what we would like to achieve. Our vision is: Make
cryptocurrency accessible and easy for everybody by developing granny proof
solutions. Our mission is: Proof
that we are the best not by saying we are the best, but by reaching top 5 for
wallet providers in the world. We are ambitious. Because of our individual skills we are an all-round team which is able to
cover the fields from marketing to actual developing. All the required skills
are in-house, together with our IT partner in India. Who are the team members? Linkedin: Junanto van der Veen : Core Skills: Project management, IT-developing, Networking, Banking
and Philosopher Linkedin: Patrick van Ek : Core Skills: Marketing, SEO, Networking, Designing and Philosopher What is this about? We are a startup in software development for cryptocurrency. A granny proof
and high level security Bitcoin wallet for Android smartphones is the product.
It is an Android application for smartphones which enables users to send and
receive secured transactions in the cryptocurrency Bitcoin. We always keep in
mind that the usability MUST be as easy as using cash. From
our perspective this is the only way to get Bitcoin “mainstream”. It is
nonsense to say that solely this app would achieve this. But we definitely try
to contribute to this process. Summarizing, the usage of cryptocurrency needs
to be granny proof and safe in order to go global it is as simple as that! Why the Easbit App? Granny proof: Bitcoin nowadays still has the image of being not user friendly and that
usage is only meant for IT people. We want to accomplish to get rid of this
image for Bitcoin. Bitcoin is meant for everybody around the globe! One thing
which really distinguished ourselves from the competition is that we found a
very user friendly way to handle the user unfriendly long Bitcoin addresses.
Therefore all that counts for us is developing a wallet which meets 100% the
needs for all kind of users. Which means: keep it stupid simple! Our goal is
everybody should be able to use our app. And by everybody we mean everybody who
uses cash today. Granny proof so to speak. Android smartphones We have consciously decided to develop a wallet for Android based
smartphones. We did this for a reason. First of all according to EMarketer.com a smartphone will become more and
more globally an essential part of our daily lives, if it isn’t already. So for
Bitcoin it will be extremely important to be easily spendable by a smartphone.
Security again plays here also a major role. A penetration of more than 33% of
the global population is estimated to have a smartphone by 2017. On the other hand we have the operating systems (OS). Our aim is that we
would like to make our app available for as much people as possible. But we
always keep in mind that what we do execute as perfect as possible. We are
taking it step by step. So we have chosen to start off with the OS Android.
Simply because it has the largest market share, it is most widely used and its
open source character. Mobile payments Our choice is also based on the future of mobile payments. Technology researcher Gartner forecasts that the worldwide mobile payment
market will have over 450 million users and a transaction value of more than
$721 billion in 2017. This represents compound annual growth rates of 18% and
35% respectively for the period 2012 to 2017. Non-US based: Privacy is a big issue. Terms like NSA, spying, malware are common
headlines these days. Of course it is not a guarantee, but the majority of the
Bitcoin firms are US-based and we are not. Only 10% is European based and 61%
US based (source: Coindesk). It brings in some balance. Security & privacy We are on top of our game when it comes to security. All critical data such
as keys and exchanged data is encrypted. We will provide easy use for
(automatic) backup facilities. The safety of your Bitcoins is our highest
priority. Accenture did a study on mobile payments. When it comes to mobile payments
there are 3 things which are important: 1. Security 2. Privacy 3. Convenience (source: Accenture ) We have developed our Android mobile application based on these
fundamentals. Storage We do not store your Bitcoins (in other words the keys) on a central
location. The main principal of Bitcoin is decentralization. This is a matter
we do not like to interfere in. So we do not store any Bitcoin related data on
our servers. The Bitcoins are stored locally on your own smartphone, just like
you carry your own cash in your own wallet. Which means you are ALWAYS really
in charge of your Bitcoins. Such thing which happened at Mt Gox is simply not
possible, because we do not store your Bitcoins, private keys, public keys,
personal information or any kind of crucial data. We only provide secured
transactions and we will be hosting user friendly services to make the usage of
your wallet as easy and secure as possible. Backup Of course we have added reliable and secured backup features. As well as
cold storage and easy restoring in case of losing you smartphone. Developing We develop our software according level 5 CMMI (Capability Maturity Model
Integration) standards. We outsource the actual coding in India. The Indian
company is a level 5 organization. Also many other Dutch leading companies are
engaged with the same company. The company usually engages with larger
companies/customers, but they were also impressed by our ideas for
cryptocurrency and found it an interesting topic, that is the reason they have
committed themselves to our startup. Level 5 means: It is a characteristic of processes at this level that the
focus is on continually improving process performance through both incremental
and innovative technological changes/improvements. (source: Wikipedia ) Working according the system does not guarantees anything of course. But it
says something about the maturity level we develop. It is also important to know is that we code native. The reason we do this
is that people spend more and more time on their smartphones. Daily activities
contain surfing the web, downloading apps, playing games and streaming videos.
Simply said it is not possible to create the same rich and functional
experiences as you would achieve with for e.g. HTML5. What we need & what you get We are currently already developing the application, and approaching final
stage of development. We have funded the development in the initial phase
so far by ourselves. In order to finish the application and fully test it we
need an additional $25k. We truly hope that you will be our supporter and contribute to our project.
We genuinely think that we can contribute to the mainstream process of Bitcoin
with our application. Of course we do not stop developing after the first
release. In case of overfunding we will spend it on additional features. We
have lots in mind as additional features! Project accounting will be shown at our website: http://www.easbit.com/project-development. The application will be released January. The Impact At a current status only 14% (source: Coindesk) of the companies involved
in the Bitcoin ecosystem are wallet providers. We think there is still a lot to
do to get Bitcoin mainstream. Especially when you think that a wallet is
basically an essential need in order to spend your Bitcoins. So it is crucial
part of the Bitcoin ecosystem. And especially this part of the ecosystem
requires granny proof software. A lot is said about Bitcoin. But there is one thing the majority agrees on
there is a need for a “Killer-App”. We are convinced that our app can
contribute to the mainstream process significantly. It is up to the crowd to
decide whether it is a killer app or not. A granny proof and safe app is all
that counts for us. Bitcoin is also described as money for nerds. Because of
its open and transparent character it should be available for everybody with a
smartphone. Processing a payment should be easier as swiping your card. That is
what we try to accomplish. Technology is for everybody. Bitcoin may leapfrog credit cards. Due to lack
of credit cards, approximately 65% and 35% (source: Coindesk) of all e-commerce
in China and India respectively conducted with cash. Another important feature of the Bitcoin is relatively cheap remittance
transactions. Remittance: Average global remittance fee of 8.14% per $200 ($16.28) Bitcoin average transaction fee is $0.004 Remittance vs Bitcoin: Bitcoin is 4,070 times cheaper on a $200
transaction. (Source: Coindesk) By using the Easbit app people can send money globally almost instantly
against very low fees comparing to traditional ways. According to Wedbush Securities can (an award-winning research
platform) Bitcoin become huge. What is said about Bitcoin? Bitcoin has also attracted the attention of some impressive people. "[Bitcoin] is a techno tour de force."
- Bill Gates , Founder of Microsoft “We have elected to put our money and
faith in a mathematical framework that is free of politics and human error.” -
Tyler Winklevoss , Co-creator of Facebook "Bitcoin may be the TCP/IP of money."
- Paul Buchheit , Creator of Gmail “ I think the fact that within the bitcoin
universe an algorithm replaces the functions of [the government] … is actually
pretty cool. I am a big fan of Bitcoin” - Al Gore , 45th Vice
President of the United States “I do think Bitcoin is the first
[encrypted money] that has the potential to do something like change the
world." - Peter Thiel , Co-Founder of Paypal "Bitcoin is a remarkable cryptographic
achievement and the ability to create something that is not duplicable in the
digital world has enormous value" - Eric Schmidt , CEO of Google Risk & Challenges There is no project without risks. And so is ours. But we did our homework.
Almost half a year of preparation, maturing our idea, writing a marketing and
business plan, preparing the granny proof design, user friendly functionalities
went by before we actually started coding. This was an essential part to get
the best user experience there possibly is. So we are at least convinced that
we did all we could within our powers. It is not only the developing that we
focus on. We also have the proper skills when it comes to market the app. This
part is at least as important to become successful. An awesome marketing plan
is also part of the whole project. If people can’t find you, you can’t expect
them to use your app! A risk for projects in general is budgeting. Due to our preparations we are
convinced we have defined our costs cautiously. As we said we are currently
already developing and costs are lower than initially expected because of
offshoring to India. Because of the months of preparations we are absolutely sure when we meet
our funding needs we can show the world the first release in January. How to contribute to the Easbit Crowdfunding Campaign? Step 1: Go to our campaign: http://igg.me/at/easbit or click the launch button in the email. Step 2 : In the upper right corner you will find the text: Select a contribution amount below. You can either choose here to contribute any desired amount or you can select any desired Perk which are shown right below. Step 3: Click on the button: Contribute. Step 4: Now you check your contribution. After checking you can click on: Continue to payment. Step 5: You can choose here to contribute through either with credit card or PayPal. When selected credit card please click: Submit payment. When selected PayPal please click: Go to PayPal. You are done. Again we thank you tremendously for contributing to our campaign! Other ways to help If you are not able to contribute to this project don’t worry! You can still help us. Please share our project through one of the tools on top of this page. You can also contribute of course by sending us Bitcoins anonymously: 1GJAsnxTVf7hUs5T18t5DMokSDq9TcfEwL

description:
Update (24.07): We are moving forward With 17 days left and US$860 collected, you have expressed your desire to make the mobile app a reality and we see that you want  and are are happy to make the app a reality! To
 get a better idea of what the new app has in store for their readers, 
fans and contributors, Cointelegraph has done a Q&A session with the
 leader of the app’s developer 
team, Addy Crezee. You can read the article here . About CoinTelegraph CoinTelegraph is one of the most popular news sites for cryptocurrencies. Our up-to-date news and information help you understand everything about the
ever-evolving world of digital currencies, whether you are a newbie or a seasoned veteran looking for the newest ways to beef up your digital wallet.
We help people to form their own opinions regarding cryptocurrency with
precise and clear coverage from our dedicated team of journalists and experts
from around the globe. We publish articles and expert opinions in the fields of
business, technology, society and law as well as provide real-time commentary
from leading experts across the entire spectrum of the Bitcoin community. About cryptocurrencies More and more businesses,
entrepreneurs, start-ups, and everyday people are beginning to adopt this technology. Its many advantages mean that it is becoming increasingly important to educate
yourself and be aware of these new financial and technological innovations.
CoinTelegraph helps you greet digital currency with open arms. The most extensive and widely-known cryptocurrency is Bitcoin, It is a revolutionary concept that can change the future of money. A digital currency with no coins or bills, it allows you to buy, sell and transfer to anyone, anywhere instantly for next to no charge. And it's everyone's to control. Our history and Stats We founded CoinTelegraph in November 2013. Since then we have grown to a large community (3-10 thousand unique visitors a day) that tells the world the freshest cryptocurrency news. Now we have our own authors all over the world, as well as illustrators and painters. Our team has developed a unique style -  this is the reason for our rapid growth. You can take a look at our Alexa rating . Our Team Maria Jones (General Manager) Allen Scott (Chief Editor) Denis Spaans (Illustrator) Our authors What do we need funding for? We need funding to build modern, high-tech  iOS and Android apps. The main part of our audience (currently 60% - this figure is constantly growing) comes from mobile devices. That means that these apps can become the tool that will help people interested in the future of money and cryptocurrencies read the latest news in the most convenient way. What We Need & What You Get We will spend gained investments on: - Google and Apple development enrollments - 124$ - Design - 1100$ - Programming (includes page-proofs and publishing) - 1900$ These are the costs of the designer and programmer that we discovered and took on board recently. They are highly qualified and have seriously impressive portfolios, and we are sure they will provide results and meet our expectations. What you get: If we get more: If we get more than 3124$,  we will spend them on writing interesting, stand-out articles! If we get less: If we fail to collect 3124$ we will continue to seek funds until we achieve the required amount. The fact is that we want a great app, and everyone should love it! We are the leaders in the field and we can't afford to let our users down, which is why we need to achieve the above figure as a minimum. Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, but want to lend us a helping hand, you can do the following : Like our community page on Facebook and invite your friends; Follow us on Twitter ; Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us reach our goal! Thank you all for sharing, supporting and contributing to create mobile apps, popularizing cryptocurrencies and making reading CoinTelegraph's news more convenient! We aim to provide the highest quality products on the market. FAQ I have some questions. How can I contact you? If you have any questions you can email us at press@cointelegraph.com. Do you have a Bitcoin adress I can donate to? Yes, you can find the details here . If you'd like to receive a perk - email us at press@cointelegraph.com . When can I get my perk? T-shirts will be sent to their recipients after the end of the campaign, which means you should get it in August. All other perks will be provided in July, during the campaign. Is shipping included? Definitely! What is our plan? According to the plans drawn up by our specialists (designer and programmer), the process of building two apps will take around 3 and a half months. Here is the plan: 1. App for iOS - Design creation for both operation systems (3 weeks) - First app compilation and fixes (2 weeks) - Second app compilation and fixes (1 week) - Final Compilation, adapting the designs for all devices and fixes ( 1 week) - Publication (up to 1 week) 2. App for Android The same operations except the design, which we just need to adapt it for Android devices. Moreover, publishing the app on the Google Play Market takes just a few hours. If our specialists fail to meet the deadlines, they pay fines. (3% per day), so they are motivated to keep to the schedule. As a result, the apps are to be a success!

description:
Hi, kami dari Komunitas Bitcoin Indonesia. Bantu kami menggalang dana untuk korban bencana asap di Indonesia dengan berdonasi di halaman fundraising ini.

Berapapun donasi yang anda berikan akan sangat bermanfaat bagi saudara kita yang terkena bencana asap.

Seluruh dana yang terkumpul akan disalurkan melalui ACT (Aksi Cepat Tanggap) untuk korban bencana asap di Indonesia. Laporan penggunaan dananya akan di update melalui halaman fundraising ini.

Mohon bantuannya juga untuk share halaman fundraising ini melalui button Facebook di kanan atas.

____________________________________

Seperti kita ketahui, beberapa bulan ini kabut asap yang disebabkan kebakaran lahan dan hutan mengganggu aktivitas teman-teman kita di beberapa wilayah di Indonesia, sebut saja Riau, Sumatera, dan Kalimantan. Faktanya asap ini tidak hanya mengganggu aktivitas namun juga menelan korban jiwa.

Per hari ini, korban terus bertambah dan masih sangat banyak anak-anak yang terpapar kabut asap dua puluh empat jam sehari sementara hujan hanya turun sekadarnya dan asap pekat terus bergulung.

Berdasarkan kepedulian akan masalah ini, saya mengajak kita semua untuk bergerak mengumpulkan dana untuk saudara-saudara kita.

100% dana yang terkumpul akan digunakan untuk membeli masker dan kaleng oksigen tambahan yang akan didistribusikan ke korban.

Jangkauan tangan kita tak cukup panjang untuk mengusir asap, namun saya dan Anda bisa menolong meringankan beban kawan-kawan kita. Nyawa Hanum tak sempat tertolong, namun kita bisa berusaha, semaksimal mungkin, agar tak perlu ada Hanum-Hanum lain yang menjadi korban paparan asap.

Mari bergerak.

Rencana Penggunaan Dana

Dana yang terkumpul akan disalurkan ke berbagai wilayah yang membutuhkan melalui ACT (Aksi Cepat Tanggap)

description:
The story of the project

**UPDATE**We are aware of the increasing difficulty with mining bitcoin, difficulty greatly affects the amount of bitcoins hardware can mine based on its performance. We want to ensure our contributors / pledgers that we have an exit strategy in place to mine alternative coin types so that we can continue to operate with profits and yield results.Our exit strategy will be PPC or PeerCoin unless another Alt Coin can yield more profits using ASIC hardware.We are a Bitcoin Mining startup with profit share contract opportunities. Unlike other online bitcoin mining services our contracts are for the life of our mining venture, which means contract owners will continue to earn a share of the NET bitcoin profits based on their purchased share percentage for the specified round. The contract will continue until the day we decide mining is no longer profitable and turn off the power to the hardware.We are already invested in mining with low performance hardware at a rate of 14 Gh/s and a combined cloud mining contract performance of 50 Gh/s.Our first round of mining hardware has already been purchased using capital from private investors ( mostly friends, family members and our selves ) We have purchased $30,000.00 AUD worth of hardware from our supplier in the US and expect delivery by March 2014. Our additional costs for that round will include customs duties and taxes on arrival and hardware set-up costs which will bring the total close to $40,000.00 AUDThe performance of the first round of mining hardware is estimated to be 6,000 Gh/s ( + / - 20% )

How the funds will be used

Our expected costsWe will be purchasing a second round of hardware asap to allow for improved performance on our mining venture.The hardware will cost $50,000.00 AUD ( 20 x 600 Gh/s mining cards at $2,500 AUD each ) with an estimated total performance of approx 20,000 Gh/s ( + / - 20% )Our expected customs duties and tax should be $5,000.00 AUD ( 10% of the hardware value )Our final cost to setup the gear and start mining is in the computer hardware that the mining cards get installed into. This cost would be approx $5,000.00 AUD ( 10 x basic performance computers )Profit calculationsUsing the following bitcoin calculator website the current estimated return on $60,000.00 AUD for 20,000 Gh/s for twelve months of constant mining is approx $1,200,000.00 AUD providing the current value of one bitcoin is $1,000 AUD.http://www.bitcoinx.com/profit/If bitcoin continues to increase in value and performs as expected with its already trending rise then this estimated value could multiply into a larger return.Project services once runningOnce we have finished setting up the project and are successfully mining we will begin to offer purchasable services from our hardware setup.Contract miningWe will be offering a contracted service to deliver to our customers a % of the mining performance for $1,000 AUD. The contract is for the life of the mining project and will terminate when the project becomes unprofitable to continue running. We will reserve the right to make this judgement based on our experience and understanding of the bitcoin technology. We estimate to be running at least 12 months. These contracted services are eligible for redemption tokens which will receive up to 99% discounts on single quantity purchases. We are offering these tokens as rewards to our supporters who pledge $1,000 to the project.

Some of my other work

We have our website set-up indicating our current round one of mining hardware and this same website will be used to display the rounds performance and returns for the round one a weekly basis.http://www.ozbitcoinminers.com.au

Challenges

RisksIf the value of bitcoin falls below $65 AUD and remains less than this for an indefinite period of time then the return would be less than the invested capital on the hardware purchased. however bitcoin has been constantly above $700 for the past 6 months and does not show any signs of falling so this risk, although still a risk is very unlikely.ChallengesOnce the hardware arrives we need to set-up and have the hardware running as soon as possible to pursuit a break even on the hardware investment, we estimate a break even about 14 days into mining but will allow for a 30 day mining period to ensure break even.Power consumption is another consideration and we would need to ensure the venture is constantly powered and profitable... if there is a sign that its not profitable then we would need to consider relocating the hardware into a scenario / location that would allow for profitability or consider shutting down the venture.

description:
What is CoolWallet?

CoolWallet is the most convenient cold storage device for Bitcoin. It is a card-like device that makes using Bitcoin safe and easy. You can use it to store, spend, and send your bitcoins. The private keys are securely protected in the card, and will not be exposed in any situation. 

Product feature

Design

How to make a transaction using CoolWallet? 

1. Enter CoolWallet app and go to the ‘Send’ page.

2. Enter receiver’s address by scanning QR code, paste or from the address book. Enter the amount if needed and press Send. CoolWallet app will request for One Time Password.

3. Simply tap the card twice or type in the One Time Password and press Confirm to send the OTP to the CoolWallet for verification.  

4. CoolWallet will verify if the OTP is correct. When OTP is correct, CoolWallet will display a flashing tick in front of the OTP. The CoolWallet screen can also show the receiving address (optional). 

Press the button on CoolWallet to send the signed transaction back to the app.

5. After pressing the button, CoolWallet will display the amount of the transaction and a sending icon.

 

6. CoolWallet app receives the signed transaction and broadcasts it to the Bitcoin network.

What We Need & What You Get

Our story 

We are a group of passionate Bitcoin supporters who are interested in new technologies and want to contribute our expertise to the future of finance. Our backgrounds are in computer security, Bitcoin, electrical engineering and being cool.

CoolBitX are dedicated in improving Bitcoin environment with easy, safe and cool technologies. We are working to improve security in Bitcoin storage and to make paying from cold storage more convenient. Our goal is to make it easier for people to use Bitcoin. We believe in Bitcoin and look forward to its continuing success.

CoolBitX Exchange with CoolWallet- keep your bitcoins with you until you sell them.

Recent Bitstamp hack event indicates that having your bitcoins under others control is not safe as you never know what would happen to them. Even big player like Bitstamp can't guarantee their security. This is why we are also working on an exchange site based on CoolWallet. You can keep your bitcoins with you till you sell them. This exchange revolution should end the lost of bitcoins to hackers.  No more Mt. Gox.

SPEC

Timeline

Our promise

We have completed the research and development of hardware CoolWallet and 90% completed the app. We just need your help to overcome the final app development cost and production of the CoolWallets.

We take quality control very seriously as this product matters to users’ fortune. We have developed various quality check methods to ensure we deliver CoolWallet in the highest standard of quality. Each package will go through both human and machine inspections. We want to give our backers the best experience.

description:
From the University of Maryland Honors Gemstone Program, Team DIRE (Dark Internet Research Exploration) plans to further the relatively unexplored field of research that is the Dark Internet, which is a subset of the World Wide Web that is accessible only with certain software and enables complete browser anonymity. 

A distinct community has emerged amongst users of the Dark Internet, with its own culture and economy that Team DIRE plans to explore in depth. In order to do so, our team aims to purchase a bitcoin in order to study its uses as an online cryptocurrency and compare the consumer experience with that of a traditional online market (such as Amazon or eBay). 

For more information on our research and the Gemstone Program, please visit:

http://teamdire.weebly.com/

http://www.gemstone.umd.edu/

 

Note: Team DIRE is unable to accept federal grants as the money raised will be used to purchase a bitcoin. Our research is conducted completely under the supervision of University of Maryland faculty.

description:
My Name is Afrikanus Kofi Akosah, I’m the Founding President of Africa Youth Peace Call, (AYPC), an independent, non-profit, research and educational organisation devoted to the principles of individual liberty, secure private property rights, free markets, the rule of law, limited government, and government non-interference in the economy.

Since 2008 we have been running the Liberty & Entrepreneurship Camps in Winter & Summer. The camps create the platform for young Africans to discover the philosophy of Liberty, and gain knowledge of entrepreneurship skills. In an era where youth unemployment has become a chronic headache in Africa as a result of weak Economic Liberty. The camp offers a rare opportunity for the youth to start businesses & institutions for political reforms.

Short Summary

Northern Ghana is the poorest part of the country. Although there’s rich land inabundance, people cannot leverage their land to, for instance, borrow money for education or starting businesses, or secure it for their children or spouses if something happens, because they have no land titles to prove the ownership of the land. This creates a lack of financial mobility, and often violent conflicts. Land titles can be done on the Bitcoin blockchain, at a very minimal costs, and without the involvement of centralized institutions. It's an unprecedented opportunity to free millions of people from poverty.

Therefore our Summer Camp is focusing on how the Blockchain Technology can be used to issue land titles. It will take place from July 19 - 23, 2015 in the Northern City of Tamale (Pronounced Tamal3) and the theme is 'Liberating Northern Ghana Economically: The Blockchain to the Rescue’.

The Impact

We are working together with BITNATION, the traditional rulers, and the people of the North to use the Blockchain Technology to issue land titles in the north this year. BITNATION has completed the first Land Title Test on the Bitcoin Blockchain in Ghana, and is working together with Ilocater, a Danish Land Survey company, to find the best model to build the BITLAND DApp including cheap survey equipment, which will be available on the BITNATION platform. AYPC will educate the youth, so they can do these DIY Governance blockchain applications themselves. 

Throughout the week participants will learn entrepreneurship skills, explore the social and economic benefits of a secure private property regime, coupled with land titles, corporate incorporation, smart contracts and more, and how the Blockchain Technology can deliver that on the cheap. They will be assisted to draw an Action Plan to educate their communities to facilitate their cooperation and smooth implementation of the Land Title Project.

 Our Blockchain Titles Ambassadors will form a network to educate the communities about the Bitcoin Blockchain Technology, and how to use it. Time will be set aside as Cryptocurrency/Blockchain Business Opportunities Day. This will enable participants to explore the business side of Bitcoin/Blockchain, and how to start their own profitable ventures with it.

Movement like Prof. Steve Horwitz, Roger Ver (BitCoin Jesus), Susanne Tarkowski Templehof, Dr. Tom G. description:
What's the idea?

The idea is to collect enough funds to buy 2-3 ASIC Miners off a reputable source which is planning on distributing them by the end of April.

These ASIC Miners will be used to mine bitcoins, if you do not know what bitcoin mining is I suggest you visit this page, the bitcoin gathered will be distributed among investors if we reach our funding goal.

 

So I get a return?

The idea is, yes! If we reach our funding goal, we will purchase the miners and start mining! The bitcoins mined will be distributed amongst the pledgers!

NOTE: We will only distribute 70% of the bitcoins mined! The rest will be used to cover costs, etc.

The return will have the following format:

Return (in bitcoins) = (amount pledged/total funding)*(amount of bitcoins mined in a week) - 10% fee

For example say you invest $50, and also imagine the bitcoins mined in a certain week is 20 bitcoins.

This means that the return you'll receive will be,

(50/5000)*20*(1-0.1) = 0.18 bitcoins

Doesn't seem like a lot? Well 0.18 bitcoins is around 18 dollars on recent bitcoin prices, 18 dollars a week for doing nothing and for an initial $50 pledge doesn't sound bad after all!

 

Why don’t I just buy a miner then?

Well our current team consists of myself and a friend both quite familiar with the bitcoin protocol and the programming around it. If you don’t have the expertise it can be quite difficult to successfully run a mining operation. We take care of that for you! Also the added hashing power of our operation will be higher than what you might get plus you would have to invest a large amount of money in hardware.

 

How do I get involved?

The first thing you can do is pledge! If we reach our funding goal then we will be quick to set up a website where users will have a friendly user interface to know what’s going on.

Once the ASIC Miners are shipped and arrive we will start mining (this can take up to 4 months as they are not fully developed yet). After some initial testing and setting up we will start distributing the mined bitcoins to our pledgers.

We must reiterate that only if our funding goal is achieved will we be able to offer these perks. The funding goal is the cost of the required hardware to make this at all profitable. If our funding goal is not achieved we will take the pledges and still set up the website but the fee might have to increase to 15-20%.

 

Thanks for pledging!

The only real potential risk is bitcoin exchange fluctuations.

description:
The story of the project

So you know what Bitcoin is and you think it's the bees knees, best bloody thing to happen since the democracy. Well, I'm with you there, my name is Gustaf and I've got a disease... (Warning: Controversial content, skip paragraph if you can’t handle the truth.) Every night I lie in bed for hours kept awake by the stark paradox within which I live. I am consumed by an ineffable idea. The idea that the truth is simple and the simple truth is that we are not free. I know we’d like to believe that we are, and sometimes comfort and security feel like they are, but the truth is they are only cheap sedatives. Freedom is a simple and powerful concept and up till now, has proven difficult to uphold economically. However there is finally something that looks a whole lot better because before Bitcoin, broken economies are all that we've bloody-well known :) You and I both know that digital currency promises an independent, better future but how many of your friends know this, 10%? 5%? 1%? The reality is that the Bitcoin community is still very small, far too small to be confident of its survival. And this is my goal, I want to facilitate and accelerate Bitcoin's global adoption through educational media. I wrote a book called, "The idiot's Guide to Bitcoin" and I am working on a new version to be published which will go to print under the name, "Bitcoin - A Citizen's guide" It all started about two years ago, a mention in passing of a revolutionary entity known as Satoshi Nakamoto and his/her/their brainchild Bitcoin. It took a while for me to fully grasp the implication of what had been said but when the moment arrived, and I had crawled out from under that cosmic ton of bricks, I had finally found a channel for all my energy. I immediately committed to spreading the good word of Bitcoin. It was a little while later that I decided that the best way to do this was to write a book that promotes Bitcoin and makes it easy for everyone and anyone to get involved. I finished “the Idiot’s Guide to Bitcoin” ebook about two months ago and released it for purchase @ www.idiotsguidetobitcoin.com The Idiot's Guide to Bitcoin is, as the name suggests, an every-man's guide to the digital currency known as Bitcoin. I believe it is a vital contribution to the Bitcoin ecosystem and so do many others. The book has received so much support since I launched it and I just want to thank you all for that. Writing and promoting the book has been a tremendously fulfilling experience especially because I've been blown away by how positive and encouraging the Bitcoin community has been. Being at ground zero for the rise of Bitcoin has been a privilege as well as just plain incredible. Never before have I encountered such a concentration of the most innovative, enlightened and inspiring individuals. As a good friend of mine put it: "Innovation comes from the edges, so it comes as no surprise that innovators are found in the margins. They are the misfits among us, the ones who see and do things differently." We have discovered great power in Bitcoin and as such we have a duty to protect and nourish it. As pioneers on a new frontier it is our responsibility as Bitcoiners to ensure the future of Bitcoin and what a bright future it is! So why am I asking you to fund a book that’s already available. Well, the Idiot’s Guide to Bitcoin is currently only in a digital form and is exclusively available from my little website. I want to turn it into something better, so to be honest there is still much work to be done but I’m an independent writer and have reached the end of my resources. In other words, I need all the help I can get to get it properly published. It’s time for the book to get the propulsion it deserves. It needs to be published and promoted on a global scale. If you’re already part of the Bitcoin sphere, which I assume you are as you've read this far, then by helping me to publish my book you help support a global endeavour to further the Bitcoin cause and in so doing you guard your own interests. Every Bitcoin start-up, every Bitcoin investment, every miner, buyer, spender, freelancer, apologist, the entire Bitcoin network will benefit from an increased global awareness and facilitated global adoption as well as reference literature. So I passionately ask you to help me publish my book and help me spread the good word of Bitcoin.

How the funds will be used

The most important result of a successful Pozible campaign will be making the book appealing and easily accessible to a significant amount of people. The Target of $15000 will comfortably but exclusively ensure this result. This will include: - Subscription to Print-on-demand services that will see that the book never goes out of print. - Worldwide distribution to a multitude of online bookstores including Amazon, Barnes and Noble, Fishpond etc. - Professional Editing - Professional criticisms and advice - 400 copies for sale in Bitcoin - Dedicated Website upgrade. - Limited PR campaign To professionally promote and advertise the book we will have to exceed our target. It is not essential to the long term success of the project to successfully raise enough money to launch a full scale PR blitzkreig but it sure will make it happen a hell of a lot quicker. A decent start would be $10,000.

Challenges

To be honest it's just a question of continuing the work I've already been doing. The main obstacle to persistence is a lack of resources which is why we're here on Pozible in the first place, should the campaign be successful then there shouldn't be too much to worry about in terms of making the book available. The costs of publishing are accurately covered in the target of $15000. The words are down and illustrations done. I will however significantly expand the new edition and it will probably be called "Bitcoin - A Citizen's Guide" but as I mentioned it's just a question of continuing the work I've been doing and if the "Make It Pozible" campaign is successful I will be able to do so.

description: We're raising money for a peer-to-peer marketplace that will revolutionize the way e-commerce is done. Contributors will receive OmniCoins to spend in the OmniBazaar marketplace. We already have a working Windows prototype of the software. Donations will fund further development of O mniBazaar and OmniCoin software . Please watch the videos and read the campaign. Seen On: OmniBazaar -- Removing Middlemen and Bankers from E-commerce OmniBazaar is a new type of e-commerce marketplace that removes the middlemen and bankers from e-commerce . OmniBazaar will allow users to buy and sell directly among themselves (rather than through a middleman site like Amazon or eBay), using Bitcoin and OmniCoin (instead of credit cards or PayPal). By using a distributed structure to eliminate the middlemen, and using Bitcoin and OmniCoin to eliminate the bankers, OmniBazaar will be able to charge users about 80% lower fees than existing e-commerce sites like eBay and Amazon. OmniBazaar will also serve the 2.5 billion "un-banked" people world-wide who cannot use existing e-commerce sites, because those sites require users to have credit cards and bank accounts. Participants anywhere in the world will be able to buy and sell in the OmniBazaar marketplace without bank accounts, credit cards, application forms, or credit checks , using only their computer , smartphone, or tablet. Individuals and small businesses will transact business among themselves using a free version of the OmniBazaar software to list and shop for products and services. Users will pay no fees to join the marketplace, no fees to shop or post listings , and no monthly or annual membership fees . Users will pay only a small (~1%) fee on each transaction to support service providers in the marketplace network. The marketplace technology to accomplish this has been designed, programmed, and a working prototype created. Funding we receive in this campaign will enable us to complete the development of OmniCoin and the OmniBazaar marketplace software. Screen shots from our working prototype Windows application: Our Mission We are creating a new economic and financial system “of the people, by the people, for the people” . We are enabling e-commerce without the middleman, and payment without bankers. We are building a secure, efficient, decentralized, online marketplace, where individuals trade directly with other individuals , instead of with multinational corporations. Participants will use currency based on mathematics and technology , instead of belief in a central government, and interact within a monetary system based on production and assets , instead of debt created by central banks. Our Values Individual liberty, Internet privacy, market freedom, and financial responsibility Building a sustainable, asset-based, independent economic system Bringing e-commerce to half the world's population who don't have bank accounts Getting cryptocurrencies into broad use by average people around the world Encouraging and promoting local, mobile, and social commerce CryptoBazaar -- Enabling Anonymous E-commerce The CryptoBazaar upgrade for the OmniBazaar software will allow you to buy and sell anonymously through the OmniBazaar marketplace, by using advanced software that can "cloak" your computer's internet address, and allow you to preserve as much personal privacy as you choose. The CryptoBazaar upgrade will include access to a peer-to-peer escrow service , provided cooperatively by other CryptoBazaar users, that will allow secure transactions between buyers and sellers who don't know or trust each other. CryptoBazaar will also provide a secure, escrowed, distributed  cryptocurrency  exchange . Imagine being able to buy and sell  cryptocurrencies  without relying on a centralized exchange. New Currency for a New Marketplace OmniCoin (XOM) is the digital currency of the OmniBazaar marketplace. People will use Bitcoins and OmniCoins to buy and sell goods and services in the OmniBazaar marketplace. The value of OmniCoins will “float” freely compared to other currencies, and the value of OmniCoins will be based on the value of the goods and services they can buy in the marketplace. OmniCoin is simple and secure to use. It is privacy-friendly , because it allows you to choose to conduct transactions that are either transparent or anonymous. Transaction processing takes seconds instead of minutes, so OmniCoin is business-friendly . Transaction processing uses relatively little computing power, so OmniCoin is eco-friendly . And, with OmniCoin, you can do transactions using an account name instead of a string of numbers. This makes OmniCoin user-friendly. Beginning at the launch of OmniBazaar and OmniCoin, we will start giving away all 20,000,000,000 OmniCoins to users of the OmniBazaar marketplace. Each new user will receive a few thousand OmniCoins when they register, and additional coins when they refer a friend or do transactions in the marketplace. We want tens or hundreds of millions of people to eventually become owners of OmniCoin and users of the OmniBazaar marketplace. So, we will give away billions of coins to millions of people who join, refer their friends, do transactions in the marketplace, and provide the services and infrastructure for the marketplace. In the beginning, OmniCoins will be free. But, as thousand, millions, or billions of people use them in the OmniBazaar marketplace, OmniCoins will find a value, as any currency does, based on the confidence people have that they can use OmniCoin to purchase valuable goods and services. OmniCoin Features Easy Addresses: Send/Receive to an account name, not a number Privacy: Transfer Invisibly To Any Name (TITAN) Distributed Escrow Anonymous Chat Internet Address Obfuscation User Reputation System Technical Specifications Blockchain Security: Delegated Proof of Stake (DPoS) Total Supply: 20,000,000,000 Block Reward: From transaction fees Block Time: ~10 seconds Initial PoW Period: None Distribution Percentage: 100% Emission Rate: Based on the number of new users and number of transactions. Developer Hold-back: None Investor Repayments: None Other Distribution: The "perks" from this crowd-funding campaign Distribution Period : As long as it takes Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Why create another cryptocurrency? Why not just use Bitcoin? There are several reasons. Bitcoin is not particularly anonymous, so we are designing OmniCoin to be more private . An address for receiving Bitcoin looks like this: 15r8p9bbciYyjn3Jo1o4UEne7XKAXPCTM3 , while an address for receiving OmniCoin looks like this: Alice_B . Bitcoin takes up to an hour to generate six confirmations of validity for a transaction, whereas OmniCoin will generate six confirmations in under a minute. Confirming Bitcoin transactions is very energy-intensive, but confirming OmniCoins is done using a small fraction of the energy and a fraction of the time. OmniCoin is also designed to be better than Bitcoin at accommodating the "micro-payment" transactions that will occur when marketplace service providers are paid a small percentage of the transaction fees from a transaction. We're also building OmniCoin with a simple, automated escrow feature that doesn't exist in other Bitcoin wallets, and a reputation tracking feature that doesn't exist anywhere in Bitcoin (that we know of). Finally, by creating a token specifically for the OmniBazaar marketplace we believe we can make the marketplace more useful and robust. Having said all that, we are building OmniBazaar to operate with both Bitcoin and OmniCoin. Wait a minute! Are you saying you plan to dump 20 billion OmniCoins onto the market when OmniBazaar launches? No. Absolutely not. The number of coins in circulation will be completely determined by how many people join and use the OmniBazaar marketplace. We will give only a small (relative to the eventual 20 billion) number of coins to each person who joins OmniBazaar, and an even smaller number of coins for referring a friend. We will distribute half the coins in this manner, over the span of as many months or years as it takes to distribute them all. We will distribute the other 10 billion coins as "reverse transaction fees" when users conduct transactions with each other in the marketplace. In other words, during the initial distribution period, we will essentially pay users a small OmniCoin bonus to buy or sell something in the marketplace. We haven't finalized the numbers yet, but let's say we give 1,000 OmniCoins to each new user who joins OmniBazaar. This represents one twenty-millionth (1/20,000,000) of the total eventual coin supply. That would be a much slower emission rate than most other coins have. We could give 10,000 coins to each new user and still have a slow emission rate. We think this is infinitely more rational and fair than most other recently introduced cryptocurrencies (especially the ones that generate all the coins in just a few weeks to enrich the developers and their friends). And we believe this distribution plan will add liquidity at the rate that is needed by the marketplace . As more people join, more OmniCoins will come into circulation. Similarly, we estimate that users will do hundreds of millions of transactions in the marketplace before the "reverse transaction fee" pool of coins is completely distributed. How can OmniCoins have value if you are giving them away? When most cryptocurrencies launch, they make a point of promoting the wonderful new features of the coin itself, with the idea that those features are somehow the basis of its value. We are taking a completely different (and radical) approach. We believe that the value of any currency lies only in the confidence people have that it can be used , today or in the near future, to acquire valuable goods and services. People can come to perceive a unit of currency as an investment, if they believe it will be more useful (valuable) in the future. But that is a different concept than its value (usefulness) as a currency today. We are giving away 20 billion OmniCoin to emphasize the fact that any cryptocurrency, by itself , is absolutely worthless. It is nothing more than some bits and bytes pushed across the Internet. Only the usefulness of a cryptocurrency gives it any value. So, we are creating a simple, secure, cooperative, distributed marketplace where OmniCoins can easily be used, and allowing OmniCoin to find its own value. If we do a good job of making the marketplace easy, safe, and inexpensive to use, and create OmniCoin with advanced features that make it useful in that marketplace, we feel certain that both OmniBazaar and OmniCoin will prosper. The price of OmniCoins may be low in the beginning. But, the more they become useful (and are used), the higher the value (and price) will become. Why charge transaction fees for services? If the marketplace is cooperative, why isn't it free? Without charges for consumers of services, and incentives for providers of services, the OmniBazaar marketplace would experience a phenomenon known as the "tragedy of the commons" . The creator of Bitcoin avoided this problem, with respect to transaction processing and network security, by providing a financial incentive for the Bitcoin "miners" who provide these services. OmniBazaar extends this concept to also include incentives for those who publish listings for others, provide escrow services, facilitate privacy in the network, etc. We strongly believe that without such a system of fees and incentives, a marketplace economic system like OmniBazaar would fail, due to the "tragedy of the commons". There is an open-source distributed marketplace project under development that aims to operate without any fees. We believe this effort is doomed to fail for the reasons given above. How will the developers benefit? The development team is a "service provider" in the marketplace, just like the Publishers, Escrow Agents, Promoters, and Privacy Facilitators. So, the developers will receive a portion of the transaction fees from marketplace transactions, just like other service providers. We are planning for that fee to be one fourth of one percent (0.25%) for both buyers and sellers. And yes, we are planning to make it mandatory -- at least in the beginning. We understand that some people may be incensed (or even enraged) by this. But we believe that most users of the marketplace will consider it reasonable and fair. After all, OmniBazaar will save sellers about 80% of the fees they would pay if they sell on Amazon or eBay. This will naturally also result in lower prices for buyers. How will you avoid criminals and terrorists? We believe people are basically good, and that the vast majority of people have no interest in engaging in criminal activities. So, we are focused on protecting the rights and privacy of the honest majority, instead of worrying about the criminal few. Attempts to "stop criminals" have too often been used as an excuse to decrease personal privacy and freedoms. We are building into OmniBazaar a self-policing system that will allow users to flag prohibited content. If a product receives a certain number of flags, that product will (essentially) be removed from the system. We have also designed a "reputation" system that will penalize sellers who list prohibited content. We have designed OmniBazaar to be a better alternative to Amazon and eBay, not to be the next Silk Road. When did the OmniBazaar/OmniCoin/CryptoBazaar project start? The first complete technical description of the peer-to-peer shopping marketplace concept was published in August, 2013 . OmniBazaar Inc. was incorporated in September 2013, to develop the project. By December 2013 we put together our core team, had a Private Placement Offering ready, further developed the technology, created two videos describing the project, and generated various marketing materials. In January 2014, we introduced OmniBazaar and the cooperative distributed marketplace concept at "Bitcoin Miami". Since that time, we have been working largely "under the radar", and have now programmed the core marketplace application and the wallet for OmniCoin. Why donate? Would you like to pay less for stuff when you shop on-line? Do you believe in personal privacy and individual liberty? Would you like to help us bring e-commerce to half of the world's population? Do you support the development and use of alternative currencies? If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, please show your support with a donation of any size. Why $50,000? We are raising this money to complete the development of OmniCoin and the OmniBazaar software. We need to hire several programmers to complete various parts of the project. Good programmers are expensive, and we need good programmers. We're close to releasing OmniCoin and OmniBazaar, but there is still some programming left to do. Achieving our goal here in the crowd-funding phase will allow us to complete the release versions of OmniCoin and the marketplace software. That will help us raise the rest of the money to make the marketplace successful. It will also show potential equity investors that we have community interest and user support . (If you are a "rock-star" programmer, and believe OmniCoin and OmniBazaar are exciting, please contact us. You might be able to help us revolutionize the way e-commerce is done.) Our Part We are a "lean" start-up with minimal over-head and expenses. We are moving fast and practice efficient "agile" software development. Funds we raise will be placed in a multi-signature Bitcoin address, publicly viewable on the blockchain, for administrative transparency. We will communicate our progress and listen to our backers. Your Part Contribute to the development of OmniCoin and the OmniBazaar software. Donate money to help us build a new type of free-market economy. Help us promote the "grass-root" usage of cryptocurrencies by ordinary people. Support our crusade for a sane, sustainable financial system. Fund us  to show your support for e-commerce privacy. Spread the Word Tell your friends. Follow us on LinkedIn . Like us on FaceBook. Follow us on Twitter. Subscribe to our YouTube channel. Donate Bitcoin BTC Address: 15r8p9bbciYyjn3Jo1o4UEne7XKAXPCTM3 To receive OmniCoin perks for your Bitcoin donation, you must register using the link below: http://eepurl.com/5z5Dn If you donate bitcoins, we encourage you to also make at least a minimum donation here on Indiegogo, so that we can count you as a (visible) campaign supporter. "Accredited Investors" (you know who you are). Click here. Notices OmniCoins are digital tokens that will be used by buyers and sellers in the OmniBazaar marketplace. The OmniBazaar marketplace has not been launched, and OmniCoins do not yet exist. When OmniCoins are released, they will have no "par value", and will never represent any ownership, voting rights, control, or dividends in OmniBazaar Inc., the OmniBazaar marketplace, or any other asset. At the time of launch, and for many months thereafter, OmniCoins will be given away free to users of the OmniBazaar marketplace. OmniCoins as "perks" cannot, therefore, be considered a "financial incentive". The financial value of OmniCoins will be essentially zero, and might never increase. Any value that OmniCoins do eventually develop will be based on their usefulness in the OmniBazaar marketplace. If you choose to receive OmniCoins as your "perk" in this crowd-funding campaign, you acknowledge that you understand you are making a donation, not an investment . OmniCoins may never be more than a "token" of our appreciation for your support. Risks and challenges The OmniBazaar software is at the prototype stage of development. The images on this page are actual screen shots from the functioning version of the prototype. OmniCoin is still also still under development. The images (coming soon) on this page are actual screen shots of the wallet, but that wallet is not yet completely functional. OmniBazaar Inc. has been developing OmniBazaar and OmniCoin for over a year. We are building OmniBazaar and OmniCoin using technology and algorithms that have already been proven to work. We have a team of talented developers, each of whom is an expert in his field. We are therefore confident in our ability to complete the project as it has been described here. The following tasks remain to complete OmniBazaar and OmniCoin: Program, test and debug the OmniCoin multi-signature distributed escrow system. Program, test and debug the OmniBazaar/OmniCoin distributed user reputation system. Create “lite” clients for Windows, OSX, Android, and iPhone. Compile full-node executables for Linux and OSX. Integrate IP obfuscation for complete anonymity. Integrate “OmniChat” secure communication module. Increase scalability of the OmniBazaar distributed database. Design and program the OmniCoin initial distribution system. Risks: Our software design, engineering, and test processes are rigorous and focused on producing high quality, well tested products. As we move towards final integration and testing of OmniBazaar and OmniCoin, we may learn that additional revision is needed to meet our quality standards. This may delay the delivery schedule. The remaining tasks may take longer than expected to complete. The rate at which we are able to complete the remaining tasks to launch OmniBazaar and OmniCoin will be determined to a considerable extent by the success of this IndieGoGo campaign. Meeting or exceeding our goal will allow us to launch more quickly. More Information If you would like more information about the technology behind OmniBazaar and CryptoBazaar, click here .

description:
Cryptosteel is an indestructible stainless steel artefact which stores your confidential information without the use of third parties. Simply hand-assemble your private sentence from the supplied letter-blocks, enclose the data in the cold wallet and rest-assured of its safety.

click here to contribute in Bitcoin

Cryptosteel is fireproof, corrosion-resistant, acid-resistant and virtually uncrushable. Furthermore, the fact that the wallet operates entirely offline means that, unlike engraved plates with a QR code, no third party can access the owner’s personal data.

Cryptosteel is the result of a long process of design evolution through which our innovative team endeavoured to marry the enduring typographical legacies of the Renaissance Gutenberg Press with the material robustness of a military dog tag.

Human history has consistently demonstrated that one cannot rely on hard drives or electronic devices to safe-guard their private information and all of the world’s biggest, ostensibly most reliable institutions are prone to dissolution. In this context Cryptosteel is marked out as an ideal confidential information storage-system: even the worst disasters cannot destroy the cold wallet’s stainless steel construction (AISI 304). 

The wallet thus stands to benefit bitcoin and non-bitcoin users alike. Cryptosteel functions as an ideal place to store passwords of any kind as well as confidential family information. 

Think of the artefact as like a readily-accessible safe deposit box: you decide what goes in and out and you are the only one who can make any changes.  

The essence of Cryptosteel is peace of mind, and the security benefits of the wallet have only been enhanced as a result of our recent collaboration with the world-leading bitcoin security specialists, SatoshiLabs. As Cryptosteel Inventor,  Wojciech Stopinski, observed: 

“If we want to become our own banks, we need to protect our assets. That's where Trezor and Cryptosteel come in. Together we have created the everlasting bitcoin safe. SatoshiLabs took the original design and functionality of Cryptosteel and upgraded it, making it even better and with increased benefits to user"

Cryptosteel comes with more than 250 stainless steel letter blocks engraved on each side. Users are able to store up to 96 characters worth of confidential information in the cold wallet in minutes, guaranteeing the data’s safety without the need for specialized tools. 

Furthermore, the fact that storing information in Cryptosteel requires no third-party contact (even with us) means the user remains in full control of their own anonymity as well as the security of their data is throughout the process.

Final Product, you are pledging for:

  • Container for up to 96 characters + more than 250 stainless steel letter blocks
  • Master Mnemonic Seed BIP39 Ready
  • Private, off-line storage for private keys and passwords
  • Lightweight, stainless steel
  • Indestructible, acid­resistant, and uncrushable
  • Fireproof up to 1200 C, or 2100 F
  • Open-Hardware: blueprints available under CC License
  • Compatibility: Bitcoin and all cryptocurrencies
  • No tools necessary
  • Made in Poland

In this respect the artefact is ideal for use in the context of ultra-secure setups involving multisig wallets. As Director of SatoshiLabs, Alena Vranova, pointed out:  "Cryptosteel will come to be used as an “eternal backup” for future generations, adding that the cold wallet “represents an advanced form of the TREZOR Recovery seed card. it’s anonymous, offline and confidential but moreover, it’s really durable, resistant to fire or water.” 

Why are we crowdfunding?

Bitcoin users made this product for the Bitcoin community.

We are collecting funds for special tools for our assembly lines. Final product have to be accomplish with mechanical press with maximum pressure of 120 tones. This will allow us to obtain proper repeatability in a big production series and allow us to produce shallow-bended, deep-press elements with engraving.

We would like to raise money for tools and stamps so we can keep the price down for customers.

The Cryptosteel team innovated the cold wallet as a result of experiencing the same difficulties that you all have in attempting to identify a storage system guaranteed to fully safeguard your information. We believe that we have come up with the solution.  

Cryptosteel is an Open Source project and full blueprints will be made available on an Open Hardware basis. All monies raised through the crowdfunding campaign will be managed with full transparency and invested in specialized tools to expand our assembly line as well as in start-up costs so as to keep retail prices at a minimum.

In addition to pledges Cryptosteel also needs your attention and interest! 

Streach Goal: $10,000 Mutant Packaging for Cryptosteel

Visit "Updates" section for additional informations according to Streach Goal 

Our Friends and Supporters

Final Thank You and Links

The Cryptosteel team feel deeply grateful to all those who have taken the time to read about our campaign and contribute what they could to helping us get off the ground and spread the word about our project.

We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life and this campaign has been worth every minute thanks to all of our generous supporters. We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us to achieve. You are part of our “Cryptosteel” community.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us! Help us spreading the word!

If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of the below-linked social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube) and help us spread the word and get things started!
